allnames: Bladen Nature Reserve
Supporting:
Cause: In 2008, the Belizean government offered a concession for Belize Hydropower Development Company to conduct feasibility research within Bladen Nature Reserve.

The concession lasts for 15 years with possible 10-year extension (Foges 2010, Let our River Flow 2010),

“It is very concerning that we would even contemplate a dam in a nature reserve,” said Lisel Alamilla, the Executive Director of Ya’axché Conservation Trust. Ya’axché is considering taking the Government to the Supreme Court for an injunction if the activities inside Bladen Nature Reserve are allowed to proceed. They believe it is “a complete disregard for the Laws of Belize, specifically the National Parks Systems Act.” (Foges 2010)

In November of last year Ya’axché Conservation Trust discovered that Belize Hydroelectric Development (BHD) had conducted an illegal ‘feasibility study’ for a proposed hydroelectric dam within the pristine, strictly protected Bladen Nature Reserve. When this illegal activity was discovered, the Belizean Ministry of Natural Resources and Forest Department ceased their actions since they had no legitimate documents for their entrance and any other activities in any protected area. 

Later, however, BHD was granted access to the nature reserve through a research permit given by the Belize Forest Department signed by the Prime Minister himself to do a research of the area, which is the subject of this PADDD event (Let our River Flow 2010, McLoughlin 2010)
Sources:
Foges, R. (2010, January 21). Controversy sparked around Belize nature reserve. Fauna and Flora International. Retrieved from http://www.fauna-flora.org/news/controversy-sparked-around-belize-nature-reserve/

Let our River Flow. (2010, April 5). Thursday May 6th 2010 Court Date: Bladen Nature Reserve. Retrieved from http://letourriverflow.weebly.com/

McLoughlin, L. (2010). Saving paradise in the Maya Mountains of Belize. The Esperanza Project. Retrieved from http://theesperanzaproject.org/tag/bladen-nature-reserve/
Study_Link: R.E. Golden Kroner et al., The uncertain future of protected lands and waters. Science. 31, 364 (6443), 881-886 (2019). DOI: 10.1126/science.aau5525.

allnames: Manuripi Heath Nature Reserve; Manuripi Amazonian National Wildlife Reserve
Supporting:
Multiple causes: Infrastructure (road), rural settlements. The redefinition was analyzed starting in 1988 due to the possible design of a connecting road between La Paz and Cobija, although it was a study that was only completed in its first phase. It is also mentioned that there was settlement occupation of settlers after the AP was created, and that they did not comply with the requirements to obtain property titles in that area.
 
Sources: 
http://www.academia.edu/28401991/Din%C3%A1mica_socio-econ%C3%B3mica_y_uso_del_suelo_en_la_Amazonia_boliviana
2001, Pablo Pacheco B. and Hernán Ávila. Socio-economic dynamics and land use in the Bolivian Amazon. Pag. 77, 78.
http://www.academia.edu/28402013/Pando_Barraqueros_madereros_y_conflictos_por_el_uso_de_los_recursos_forestales
Pablo Pacheco B. Barraqueros, loggers and conflicts over the use of forest resources. Pag. 192,193.

Supreme Decree 25906 article 2 \Se adopta las recomendaciones emanadas del Plan de Uso del Suelo de Pando sobre la redefinición de límites
Sources: y se valida la propuesta contenida en el mapa del PLUS Pando
Map_Details: por lo que la Reserva Nacional de Vida Silvestre Amazónica Manuripi tiene una superficie aproximada de 747.000 Has...\". Plan de Uso del Suelo de Pando (PLUS) page 51. \"Recomendations.- Redefinir los límites de la Reserva y revisar su categoría
Map_Sources: considerando el establecimiento de un Area Natural de Manejo Integrado
Notes: donde se combinen desarrollo y conservación. En el plan de manejo integral se recomienda incluir las siguientes actividades: desarrollo de estudios complementarios y de mayor detalle; establecimiento de zonas de amortiguamiento a lo largo de las carreteras y cerca de las poblaciones ubicadas al interior de la Reserva; diseño e implementación de una estrategia para mejorar los servicios básicos y brindar asistencia técnica a los pobladores; regularización de la tenencia de la tierra; desarrollo de un programa de manejo de recursos naturales; desarrollo de un programa de recreación y ecoturismo; efectivización del control de caza y colecta; evaluaciones de impacto ambiental para las actividades de extracción de oro y explotación de petróleo; protección de los ecosistemas y regulación de cuencas; implementación de un programa de educación ambiental y extensión; implementación de un programa de administración; contratación y capacitación de personal\" (\"The recommendations emanating from the Pando Land Use Plan on the redefinition of boundaries are adopted
Date_Add: and the proposal contained in the PLUS Pando map is validated
Last_Update: so that the Manuripi National Wildlife Reserve has an approximate area of ​​747
AddedBy: 000 Has. ... \"Pando Land Use Plan (PLUS) page 51.\" Recommendations.- Redefine the boundaries of the Reserve and revise its category
isLatestVe: considering the establishment of a Natural Area of ​​Integrated Management
Data_Status: where development and conservation are combined . In the integral management plan it is recommended to include the following activities: development of complementary studies and in greater detail; establishment of buffer zones along roads and near populations located within the Reserve; design and implementation of a strategy to improve basic services and provide technical assistance to the inhabitants; Regularization of land tenure; development of a natural resource management program; development of a recreation and ecotourism program; effective hunting and collection control; environmental impact assessments for gold mining and oil exploitation activities; ecosystem protection and watershed regulation; implementation of an environmental education and extension program; implementation of an administration program; recruitment and training of personnel\")."

primarynam: Rio Vermelho C State Sustainable Yield Forest
allnames: Floresta Estadual de Rendimento Sustentado Rio Vermelho \C\""
Supporting: Rio Vermelho C State Forest was degazetted in February 2014 due to a legislative decree passed by the State Assembely of Rodonia, which revoked its creation decree (no. 4.567 of 1990/3/23). This was a systemic PADDD event as the decree that was revoked created Rio Vermelho C State Forest, Jaci-Parana Extractive Reserve, Rio Madeira B State Forest, and Rio Madeira Environmental Protection Area. Protected areas in the region face frequent pressure from illegal logging and cattle ranching. The degazettements were a response to the call from thousands of farmers who fear being evicted from these conservation areas, where they are residing illegally. by the government (Rodonia Juridico 2014). The Governor Confucio Moura signed the revocation decree. However, in April 2014 a court ruled a suspension of the degazettements, putting their status once again in limbo.
Sources: ISA. Rio Vermelho C State Forest. UCSocioambiental.  http://uc.socioambiental.org/en/uc/5783  ;   DECRETO LEGISLATIVO N.509 de 19/02/2014. http://uc.socioambiental.org/anexos/1457_20140319_122207.pdf  ; Rodonia Juridico. 2014. allnames: Reserva Extrativista do Rio Gregório
Supporting:
Para constituir o novo perímetro, foram ampliados 152 mil hectares a oeste dos antigos limites da Resex, sobre o município de Ipixuna, e excluídos 40 mil hectares da antiga área. Segundo o deputado estadual David Almeida (PSD-AM), líder do governo na assembleia legislativa do Amazonas, essa área foi desafetada porque o estado não poderia arcar com a indenização de uma propriedade particular não identificada quando a UC foi criada, em 2007. Fonte: https://www.socioambiental.org/pt-br/noticias-socioambientais/reserva-extrativista-do-rio-gregorio-am-e-ampliada-em-mais-de-118-mil-hectares 

To form the new perimeter, 152 thousand hectares were extended west of the old limits of the Resex, on the municipality of Ipixuna, and excluded 40 thousand hectares of the old area. According to State Representative David Almeida (PSD-AM), the government leader in the legislature of Amazonas, this area was denied because the state could not afford the compensation of an unidentified private property when the CU was created in 2007. Source : https://www.socioambiental.org/en-us/noticias-socioambientais/reserva-extrativista-do-rio-gregorio-am-e-ampliada-em-more-of-118-mil-hectares

allnames: Floresta Nacional do Tapajós
Supporting: In 2012 the Tapajós National Forest was downsized by a total of 17,851 hectares in order to excise two regions that had previous human settlements: to the northeast, the communities of Aveiro São Jorge, Nova Vida, Nossa Senhora de Nazaré e Santa Clara, along the margin of the BR-163 highway (total of 11,900 ha); and the urban area of the Aveiro municipality along the Tapajos river(total of 5,861 ha). Thus, the 60000 hectares that had since its inception, is replaced by 582 149 hectares. This is part of MP558/2012 which downsized multiple protected areas in the Tapajos region, primarily for hydropower development. The regions were excised to \Viabilizar a regularização de áreas das comunidades de Aveiro e São Jorge (PA).\" Map available from: http://confins.revues.org/7595#quotation"

primarynam: Margem Esquerda do Rio Negro Environmental Protection Area
allnames: Área de Proteção Ambiental da Margem Esquerda do Rio Negro
Supporting: This bill altered the boundaries of PES Rio Negro Setor Sul and APA Margem Esquerda do Rio Negro (Setor Aturiá-Apuauzinho) and created the RDS Puranga Conquista. The APA formerly had an area of 643.215 hectares (UCSocioambiental data; area was 623.33 ha according to ISA), and now has 611.008 ha. Thus the APA was downsized by 322.07 ha.  This downsize occurred when a 2001 bill that had expanded the park was revoked in March 2014 by Law 4015 (24/03/2014).The newly created RDS Puranga Conquista was created for the subsistence use of traditional populations, and has an area of 76,936 ha, partly overlapping in the regions downsized from the PES and APA. A new map shown on ISA's website (2014).
Sources: ISA. PES do Rio Negro Setor Sul. http://uc.socioambiental.org/en/uc/5545   ;  Diario Oficial. Lei 4015. 2014. March 24. Available from http://uc.socioambiental.org/anexos/1466_20140401_142743.pdf

allnames: Parque Estadual Corumbiara
Supporting:
Although created in 1990 with the extension of 586,031 ha (Decree 4576 of 23/03/90), the issuance of purchase and sale ( CPCVs ) by INCRA in 1991 /1992, contracts resulted in a reduction of 152,215 ha of park land which originally protected the headwaters of the rivers that drain into the Park. Then, in 1996, the Legislature approved the Rondônia State Law no. 690 of 12.27.96 , which reduced the area of the park to 424,339 hectares, in order to legitimize the rural settlements whom had settled within the Park boundaries.
In 2002 , the Park was downsized again. On the last day of the term of former governor of Rondônia , Jose de Abreu Bianco , the Legislature approved the State Law no. 1,171 of 31/12/02 , excluding over 40,284 hectares of the park, to the benefit of large rural property owners. The 1996 and 2002 reductions in Corumbiara State Park total 201,975 hectares , representing 34 % of the original area of the conservation unit . The bills were approved in the absence of environmental impact studies (Instituto Socioambiental n.d.)

primarynam: Rio Madeira B State Sustainable Yield Forest
allnames: Floresta Estadual de Rendimento Sustentado do Rio Madeira \B\""
Supporting: Rio Madeira C State Forest was degazetted in February 2014 due to a legislative decree passed by the State Assembely of Rodonia, which revoked its creation decree (no. 4.567 of 1990/3/23). This was a systemic PADDD event as the decree that was revoked created Rio Vermelho C State Forest, Jaci-Parana Extractive Reserve, Rio Madeira B State Forest, and Rio Madeira Environmental Protection Area. Protected areas in the region face frequent pressure from illegal logging and cattle ranching (). The degazettements were a response to the call from thousands of farmers who fear being evicted from these conservation areas, where they are residing illegally. by the government (Rodonia Juridico). The Governor Confucio Moura signed the revocation decree. However, in April 2014 a court ruled a suspension of the degazettements, putting their status once again in limbo.
Sources: ISA. Rio Madeira B State Forest.  Fica ampliada a área da Reserva Extrativista Guariba-Roosevelt, que foi criada pelo Decreto no. 9.521, de 19 de junho de 1996, localizada nos Municípios de Aripuanã e Colniza, totalizando aproximadamente 164.224,00 ha (cento e sessenta e quatro mil duzentos e vinte e quatro hectares), e perímetro de 654,74 km. Este decreto foi sustado pelo Decreto Legislativo no 51/2016, reduzindo a área da Resex para a área anterior de 57.630 hectares segundo a Lei 10261/2015. Em junho de 2017, uma decisão da Justiça, em caráter liminar, suspendeu o Decreto Legislativo no 51/2016, e volta a conter a área anterior de 164.224,00 ha. In 2015, in a decision that was later revoked by the state, the area was reduced to the original limit by Law 10,261 / 2015. In April of that same year, the state government went back on the decision and expanded the area by means of a decree.
  The area of the Guariba-Roosevelt Extractive Reserve, which was created by Decree no. 9,521, dated June 19, 1996, located in the municipalities of Aripuanã and Colniza, totaling approximately 164,224.00 ha (one hundred and sixty-four thousand two hundred twenty-four hectares), and a perimeter of 654.74 km. This decree was stopped by Legislative Decree 51/2016, reducing the area of Resex to the previous area of 57,630 hectares according to Law 10261/2015. In June 2017, a court decision, in an injunction, suspended Legislative Decree no. 51/2016, and restrained the previous area of 164,224.00 ha. Source: https://uc.socioambiental.org/uc/2831

allnames: Parque Estadual de Guajará-Mirim
Supporting: Law 1.146, of 12/12/2002 altered the boundaries of Guajará-Mirim State Park by excluding 4,906 hectares in the northern region of the Park in order to make way for the federal highway BR-421, which was opened illegally by loggers and ranchers. As an offset to the loss, the same law adds 14,325 hectares in the southeast of the park (Subarea 2.2) in part of the area removed by Law No. 700/96. This second law however was suspended by an injunction from the Federal Court, because of disagreement with Complementary Law n°233/2000 and other legal standards.

primarynam: Rio Negro Setor Sul State Park
allnames: Parque Estadual Rio Negro Setor Sul
Supporting:
Law 4015, 03/24/2014: Alters the boundaries of the PES Rio Negro Sector South and the APA left bank of Rio Negro (Sector Aturiá-Apuauzinho) and creates the RDS Puranga Conquest. Pes, which previously had 157,807 hectares (ISA area 154,662 hectares) now has 86,601 hectares.
Original text: “Altera os limites do PES Rio Negro Setor Sul e da APA Margem esquerda do Rio Negro (Setor Aturiá-Apuauzinho) e cria a RDS Puranga Conquista. O Pes, que anteriormente tinha 157.807 hectares (área ISA 154.662 hectares) passa a ter 86.601 hectares.” (https://uc.socioambiental.org/uc/5545)
In 2005, Brazil's Rural Agriculture Agency (INCRA) instituted the Sustainable Development Project Cuieiras/Anavilhanas (also known as called Cuieiras - Apuaú) in the northern half of Rio Negro Setor Sul State Park. Then, in 2010, Lei 3.572 (28/12/2010) authorized the Governor to transform the areas of the park used by traditional communities into a lower protected area category: Reserva de Desenvolvimento Sustentável. As of May 2013, a proposal is under consideration that would downgrade half of Rio Negro State Park to form a Sustainable Development Reserve, in order to restore use rights to traditional populations living within the Park that depend directly on the extraction of natural resources. To be exact, the proposal would make the area of Rio Negro State Park to be 77,950 hectares, and the new Reserva de Desenvolvimento Sustentável Cuieiras to be 86,233 hectares. This means that 86,233 ha of the original Park area is proposed to be downgraded to a lower protected status.
Sources: Bernard, E., Penna, L., & Araújo, E. (2014). Downgrading, Downsizing, Degazettement, and Reclassification of Protected Areas in Brazil. Conservation Biology       ;         MMA. N.d. allnames: Área de Proteção Ambiental Nhamundá; Área de Proteção Ambiental Guajuma; Parque Estadual Nhamundá (nome anterior)
Supporting: Nhamundá State Park was downgraded from strict protection to sustainable use category, and had its name changed to Guajuma Environmental Protection Area. This new designation allowed the passage of Tucuruí electrical line. Also, this region is known to have many mineral deposits, and studies are underway to explore the area for mineral exploitation (Vandre 2011).  PES Nhamundá, passou do status de proteção integral para de uso sustentável, agora chamada de APA Guajuma. A alteração permite a passagem do Linhão de Tucuruí, que irá levar energia elétrica do Pará até Manaus. A fronteira da APA Guajuma tem grande potencial de mineração, especialmente de exploração de bauxita e calcário (Vandre 2011)
Sources: Bernard, E., Penna, L., & Araújo, E. (2014). Downgrading, Downsizing, Degazettement, and Reclassification of Protected Areas in Brazil. allnames: Área de Proteção Ambiental do Rio Madeira
Supporting: Dispõe sobre a exclusão de áreas da Estação Ecológica Estadual Serra Três Ir-mãos, da Área de Proteção Ambiental Rio Madeira, da Floresta Estadual de Rendi-mento Sustentado do Rio Vermelho - C e da Reserva Extrativista Jacy-Paraná edestina tais áreas para formação do lago artificial da barragem da Usina Hidrelétri-ca de Santo Antônio. Fica excluída da Área de Proteção Ambiental Rio Madeira, localizada no Município de Porto Velho e criada pelo Decreto no 5.124, 6 dejunho de 1991, área de 797,9222 hectares. A Área de Proteção Ambiental RioMadeira passa a ter área de 5.554,0884 hectares. / It deals with the exclusion of areas of the Serra Três Ir-manos State Ecological Station, the Rio Madeira Environmental Protection Area, the Rio Vermelho-C Sustained Income Forest and the Jacy-Paraná Extractive Reserve. artificial lake of the dam of the Santo Antônio Hydroelectric Power Plant. It is excluded from the Rio Madeira Environmental Protection Area, located in the Municipality of Porto Velho and created by Decree 5,124, June 6, 1991, an area of 797,9222 hectares. The Rio Madeira Environmental Protection Area now has an area of 5,554,0884 hectares.

allnames: Parque Estadual de Candeias
Size_Pre: unk
Supporting: Candeias State Park was degazetted in 2010, as part of an agreement between the Governor of Rodonia and the President which changed the size, and status of multiple protected areas in the state of Rondonia, in order to develop the Jirau Hydroeletric Complex in the region (Bernard et al. 2014, Verissimo et al. 2010). This agreement between the federal government and Rondônia was signed on 2 June 2009 and ruled that Bom Futuro's 272,000 hectares of National Forest would be converted into three distinct areas: one 70,000 ha Environmental Protected Area (APA), one 70,000 ha State Forest to be administered by the State of Rondônia, and one 132,000 ha Federal protected area to be managed by the Chico Mendes Institute for Biodiversity (ICMBio). In return, the state would transfer to the Union 180,000 ha for the  creation of the Federal protected area This new Federal protected area would result from the sum of four units:. Rio Vermelho State forests A and B, and the Ecological Stations of Serra dos Três Irmãos and Antonio Mujica Nava. In summary, the federal government wanted to speed up the states' permitting and licensing of the Jirau hydroelectric project (MPF/RO 2010).
Sources: Bernard, E., Penna, L., & Araújo, E. (2014). Downgrading, Downsizing, Degazettement, and Reclassification of Protected Areas in Brazil. Conservation Biology    ;  Estado de Rodonia. 2010. A map of the Rodonia protected areas affected by by Lei Complentar no. 581, among other laws, can be found here: http://site-antigo.socioambiental.org/nsa/detalhe?id=3135  .   This agreement between the federal government and Rondônia was signed on 2 June 2009 and ruled that Bom Futuro's 272,000 hectares of National Forest would be converted into three distinct areas: one 70,000 ha Environmental Protected Area (APA), one 70,000 ha State Forest to be administered by the State of Rondônia, and one 132,000 ha Federal protected area to be managed by the Chico Mendes Institute for Biodiversity (ICMBio). In return, the state would transfer to the Union 180,000 ha for the  creation of the Federal protected area This new Federal protected area would result from the sum of four units:. Rio Vermelho State forests A and B, and the Ecological Stations of Serra dos Três Irmãos and Antonio Mujica Nava. In summary, the federal government wanted to speed up the states' permitting and licensing of the Jirau hydroelectric project (MPF/RO 2010). primarynam: Rio Negro Setor Sul State Park
allnames: Parque Estadual Rio Negro Setor Sul (AM)
Supporting: This bill altered the boundaries of PES Rio Negro Setor Sul and APA Margem Esquerda do Rio Negro (Setor Aturiá-Apuauzinho) and created the RDS Puranga Conquista.  The PES, which formerly had an area of 157,807 hectares (UCSocioambiental data; area was 154,662 ha according to ISA) now has an area of 86,601 hectares, which constitutes a downsize of 71,206 ha.This downsize occured when a 2001 bill that had expanded the park was revoked in March 2014 by Law 4015 (24/03/2014). The newly created RDS Puranga Conquista was created for the subsistence use of traditional populations. New map shown on ISA's website (2014).
Sources: ISA. PES do Rio Negro Setor Sul.UCSocioambiental. http://uc.socioambiental.org/en/uc/5545   ;  Diario Oficial. Lei 4015. 2014. March 24. Available from http://uc.socioambiental.org/anexos/1466_20140401_142743.pdf

primarynam: Rio Mequéns State Sustainable Yield Forest
allnames: Floresta Estadual do Rio Mequéns
Supporting:
Rio Mequéns State Sustainable Yield Forest was degazetted in 2010, as part of an agreement between the Governor of Rodonia and the President which changed the size, and status of multiple protected areas in the state of Rondonia, in order to develop the Jirau Hydroeletric Complex in the region (Bernard et al. 2014, Imazon 2010). During the degazettement, however, a portion (508km2) of the reserve was incorporated into Parque Estadual Corumbiara. See following explanation from the current PE Corumbiara website ( http://uc.socioambiental.org/en/uc/2210 ):  
“Até 2010 apresentava 50.800 ha de sobreposição com a FLORSU do Rio Mequéns, revogada pela Lei Complementar Estadual N 586, de julho/2010.\",Bernard

allnames: Floresta Nacional de Roraima
Supporting:
“At the federal level, there were two cases of legislative proposals for downsizing UCs.  Senators and Federal Representatives promoted the downsizing of the FLONA (National Forest) Roraima and FLONA Bom Future through a law for converting a provisional measure, The reason for downsizing the FLONA Roraima was its overlap with the TI Yanomami (95% overlap). However, they took advantage of the opportunity to degazette 910 km2 of lands illegally allocated for settlements by INCRA (3% of the FLONA Roraima area). As compensation, INCRA donated around 750 km2 of adjacent forest land to the UC.” (Araújo and Barreto 2011)

In the enacted law the FLONA has retained 630,5km2 of the original area which had no overlap with the Yanomami land and was not converted to INCRA settlements and 1042km2 of added offset areas adjacent to the original area, totaling 167.268km2 (https://uc.socioambiental.org/arp/652)
Sources:
Araújo, E., Barreto, P., 2011. The State of the Amazon: Formal threats to Protected Areas in the Amazon.  IMAZON, Para.

Instituto Socioambiental - ISA. Unidades de Conservação do Brasil (https://uc.socioambiental.org/arp/652)

S.M. Pack et al., Protected area downgrading, downsizing, and degazettement (PADDD) in the Amazon. Biological Conservation. 197, 32–39 (2016). DOI: 10.1016/j.biocon.2016.02.004.

primarynam: Rio Vermelho C State Sustainable Yield Forest
allnames: Floresta Estadual de Rendimento Sustentado Rio Vermelho \C\" "
Supporting: Rio Vermelho (C) State Sustainable Yield Forest was downsized in 2000 by 161.65 km2 (GTA 2008), to develop hydropower infrastructure (GTA 2008). \The Rondônia State Government used executive decrees to downsize two state UCs (Rio Paacas-Novas and Rio Preto-Jacundá State Extractive Reserves)
Sources: and the revision of the ZSEE (Socioeconomic-Ecological Zoning  of the state of Rondônia) to downsize two (Sustainable Yield State Forests (FERS) Rio Vermelho B and FERS Rio Vermelho C) and degazette ten (FLOREX Laranjeiras; FERS Rio Abunã; FERS Rio Madeira C; FERS Rio Mequéns; FERS Rio Roosevelt; FERS Rio São Domingos; FERS Rio Vermelho; FERS Rio Vermelho D; PE Candeias and PE Serra dos Parecis) state UCs\" (GTA 2008). \"The executive decrees were issued in 1989 and 1990 and are unconstitutional. The ZSEE was prepared in 1988 and the UCs that were downsized or degazetted during its revision were established in 1990. In 2000
Map_Details: the law revising the ZSEE changed the size and classification of the zones
Map_Sources: and previously established UCs were left out of the zones that would be appropriate for them. The State Government then used that fact as an argument to consider them downsized or degazetted. This attitude
Last_Update: which requires a law for changes to a UC; and Article 27 of the law revising the ZSEE
AddedBy: which ratifies all of the state acts for establishing UCs. Nonetheless
Data_Status: the Rondônia Legislative Assembly began legalizing these arbitrary changes by revoking through complementary law the decrees that had established these UCs.\" (Araujo and Barreto 2010)."

allnames: Floresta Nacional Bom Futuro
Supporting: “The downsizing of the FLONA Bom Futuro resulted from an agreement between the government of Rondônia and the MMA (Ministry of the Environment). In 2009, the Governor of Rondônia demanded the downsizing of the FLONA Bom Futuro in order to regularize an illegal occupation. In return, he would grant a environmental permit necessary to the construction of the Jirau hydroelectric dam – a federal project. The federal government proposed the degazettement of a state UC that would be partially flooded by the undertaking and three other adjacent state UCs so as to establish another federal UC and this was granted.” (Araújo and Barreto 2011)
Sources: Araújo, E., Barreto, P., 2011. The State of the Amazon: Formal threats to Protected Areas in the Amazon.  IMAZON, Para. Retrieved from https://imazon.org.br/PDFimazon/Ingles/the_state_of_amazon/formal_threaths.pdf

primarynam: Rio São Domingos State Sustainable Yield Forest
allnames: Floresta Estadual de Rendimento Sustentável (FLORSU) do Rio São Domingos
Supporting: Rio São Domingos State Sustainable Yield Forest was degazetted in 2010, as part of an agreement between the Governor of Rodonia and the President which changed the size, and status of multiple protected areas in the state of Rondonia, in order to develop the Jirau Hydroeletric Complex in the region (Bernard et al. 2014, Verissimo et al.  2010). When the FLORSU Rio São Domingos was degazetted, however, 10.79% of its area was incorporated into REXEX Rio Cautário. So, the area affected by this PADDD event was 89.21% of the total area of the FLORSU.
Sources: Bernard, E., Penna, L., & Araújo, E. (2014). Downgrading, Downsizing, Degazettement, and Reclassification of Protected Areas in Brazil. Conservation Biology    ;  Estado de Rodonia. 2010. allnames: Reserva Extrativista Estadual Jaci-Paraná
Supporting: The Legislative Assembly of Rondônia held a special meeting on Tuesday February 11, 2014 to vote on the Draft Legislative Decree (PDL) 143/14, halting the decree of 7335 January 17, 1996, which created the Jaci Parana State Extractive Reserve….With PDL approved, the law that created the RESEX expires -- Thus, the reserve is degazetted. The next step will be to change the Socio-Ecological Economic Zoning, a third approach....The special meeting followed a public hearing held on the last Friday ( 02/07/14), in Buritis, convened by the Commercial Association, Town Hall and Ranchers Association. The decree was adopted by 15 votes in favor and one abstention, many in attendance were relieved, as there was a previous court ruling which ordered the withdrawal of the families and cattle currently living in the Reserve.  Mr Edson Martins (PMDB) opened the discussion noting that the decree is collectively authored and aims to meet the needs of the local population, which has resided in the area for more than 15 years. \The decision of the Assembly is fairly and consistently in favor of the population
Sources: \" he added. Congressman Carlos Neodymium (PSDC)
Map_Details: stated that the \"The ecological reserve was created by decree
Map_Sources: but there already existed a school
Notes: built by the state.  How can the government now say that the area is a reserve?...The role of parliament is to legislate and represent the people and we should not fear the threats that will be processed by this decision.\" Congressman (PMDB) Zequinha Araújo stated that although the situation in Jaci-Paraná has been resolved
Date_Add: there are still other protected areas such as Rio Pardo and Jacinópolis which suffer from similar problems [conflicts over land use rights].   \"It does not matter if you are small or large farmers
Last_Update: what matters is that they are workers who helped and still help in the growth of Rondônia\" he said. In closing
AddedBy: Ribamar Mr Araujo (PT)  stressed that the only development model that works in practice today is the forest giving way to agriculture and ranching (RodoniaDinamica.com 2014). The Extractive Reserve was created by State Decree 7
Data_Status: 000 hectares (Complementary Law 52/91). It was later downsized in 1996 (by State Law 692 of 27/12/1996) to 191
Study_Link: a decrease of 13
Off_Type: 757 hectares (about 6% of its original area) . Its boundaries were changed again in 2011 to make room for the San Antonio dam flood zone

Event Reversed by the Court of Justice of Rondônia. ADI 0003755-58.2014.822.0000. Reversed the degazettement of four protected areas: Jaci-Paraná Extractive Reserve, Rio Madeira Environmental Protection Area, Rio Madeira B State Sustainable Yield Forest, and Rio Vermelho State Sustainable Yield Forest. 
Year PADDDed: 2014
Year brought to court: 2014
Year decision made: 2016
Decision: PADDD reversed due to ADI
Link: https://tj-ro.jusbrasil.com.br/jurisprudencia/389163318/direta-de-inconstitucionalidade-adi-37555820148220000-ro-0003755-5820148220000/inteiro-teor-389163320

Embora esta Resex tenha sido revogada pelo Decreto Legislativo estadual No506 DE 11/02/2014, o Ministério Público do Estado de Rondônia, em abril de 2014, concedeu liminar suspendendo o Decretos Legislativos de nos. 506/2014, 507/2014, 508/2014 e 509/2014. Ou seja, suspendendo a revogação da Resex.

primarynam: Rio Vermelho B State Sustainable Yield Forest
allnames: Floresta Estadual de Rendimento Sustentável (FLORSU) do Rio Vermelho B
Supporting: Rio Vermelho (B) State Sustainable Yield Forest was degazetted in 2010 (Lei Complementar Nº 581 de 30/06/2010). A small portion (0.54023 km2)  was incorporated into Mapinguari National Park. This was part of an agreement between the Governor of Rodonia and the President which changed the size, status, and administration (transferring between federal and state) of multiple protected areas in the state of Rondonia, in order to develop the Jirau Hydroeletric Complex in the region (Bernard et al. 2014, Verissimo et al.  2010). When the CU was degazetted, however, a portion of the CU was incorporated into Mapinguari National Park. Thus, the area affected by this PADDD event is smaller than the total area of the CU before PADDD was enacted. The bill, Lei Complementar Nº 581 de 30/06/2010, states that \Art.  4º.  Ficam  revogados  os  seguintes Decretos: I  –  Decretos  nº 4574

primarynam: Rio Abunã State Sustainable Yield Forest
allnames: Floresta Estadual de Rendimento Sustentável (FLORSU) do Rio Abuña
Supporting: Rio Abunã State Sustainable Yield Forest with a total area of 622 km2 (GTA 2008) was degazetted in 2010 (Bernard et al. 2014, Verissimo et al. 2010). \The Rondônia State Government used executive decrees to downsize two state UCs (Rio Paacas-Novas and Ro Preto-Jacundá State Extractive Reserves)
Sources: and the revision of the ZSEE (Socioeconomic-Ecological Zoning  of the state of Rondônia) to downsize two (Sustainable Yield State Forests (FERS) Rio Vermelho B and FERS Rio Vermelho C) and degazette ten (FLOREX Laranjeiras; FERS Rio Abunã; FERS Rio Madeira C; FERS Rio Mequéns; FERS Rio Roosevelt; FERS Rio São Domingos; FERS Rio Vermelho; FERS Rio Vermelho D; PE Candeias and PE Serra dos Parecis) state UCs\" (GTA 2008). \"The executive decrees were issued in 1989 and 1990 and are unconstitutional. The ZSEE was prepared in 1988 and the UCs that were downsized or degazetted during its revision were established in 1990. In 2000
Map_Details: the law revising the ZSEE ( Lei Complementar no. 233/00 ) changed the size and classification of the zones
Map_Sources: and previously established UCs were left out of the zones that would be appropriate for them. The State Government then used that fact as an argument to consider them downsized or degazetted. This attitude
Last_Update: which requires a law for changes to a UC; and Article 27 of the law revising the ZSEE
AddedBy: which ratifies all of the state acts for establishing UCs. Nonetheless
Data_Status: the Rondônia Legislative Assembly began legalizing these arbitrary changes by revoking through complementary law the decrees that had established these UCs.\" (Araujo and Barreto 2010)."

allnames: Wildlife Sanctuary
Supporting:
Sub-decree 128, Section C, dated 13 August 2009 to designate 5000ha as a sustainable use zone, and to grant it to Reththy Kiri Seyma for Agro-industrial crop and rubber. ELC canceled on 2014. However ~ 3000 ha were donated to families.

Concession granted to Rethy Kiri Seyma Co., Ltd. via Royal Government of Cambodia Sub-Decree No. 128, Section C, on 13 August 2009.  This constitutes a downgrade of 50km2 of Snuol Wildlife Sanctuary, allowing the concessionaire to develop a rubber plantation.

“Sub-decree 128, dated 13 August 2009 to designate the land as a sustainable use zone, and to grant it to the company.” (Subedi 2012)

“Royal Government of Cambodia
No: 128 ANK. BK (Or.Nor.Kro. Bor.Kor
Sub-Decree On Determination Management area in Natural Protections area to Sustainable Using Area
Decides:
Article 1: The seven sustainable using areas, development and investment, are in Natural Protection area according to Natural Area Protection law such as:...
C. Has determined Snoul Wildlife Sanctuary in area of five thousand hectare (5,000ha) to sustainable using area in geographical Seima District  Mondulkiri Province for provide to RITTY KIRI SEIMA Co.,Ltd to development investment on Rubber plantation, Agro-industry plantation as the map and coordinate in annex 3.”... (Royal Government of Cambodia 2009)

Background:
This event is one of 27 known PADDD events in Snuol Wildlife Sanctuary.  In 2009 and 2010, there were a number of Economic Land Concessions (ELC’s) granted to companies within Snuol Wildlife Sanctuary via sub-decrees from the Government of Cambodia for the purpose of establishing rubber plantations.  For most concessions, this followed a two-step process: (1) The concession was initially granted as a “sustainable use zone,” (allowing rubber plantation development) and was still zoned as state public land, and (2) The concession was re-zoned as state private land.  As the first step changed the allowed land use, this constitutes a downgrade (i.e., PADDD event).  The second step does not change the allowed land use and the concessions are still within federal ownership, so these do not constitute additional PADDD events.  Accordingly, all information for the preceding have been combined into single events for each concession.  Subsequent to the above process, some ELC’s underwent a third “step,” where another sub-decree excised a portion of a given concession that was donated “to the people” or designated as a “community area.”  These events constitute a downsize, and thus a new PADDD event.

LICADHO (Cambodian League for the Promotion and Defense of Human Rights), 2013. Economic land concessions for agriculture and Industrialization granted in Cambodia between 1998-2012. Data obtained from LICADHO, March 2013.

allnames: National Park
Supporting:
Sub-decree 29, dated 15 February 2011, to designate the area to be the sustainable use land and to grant it to Noupheap Sophy for Rubber plantation

Cause: logging to allow rubber plantation establishment
Details: Prime Minister Hun Sen has authorised the felling of about 9,000 hectares of protected forestland in Ratanakkiri’s Vereak Chey National Park by a private company for a new rubber plantation. A sub- decree signed by Hun Sen on February 15 stated that rights to clear-cut part of the protected forest area would be granted to the Srun Sovannaphoum Investment Co Ltd to plant rubber as part of a new special economic zone in Ratanakkiri province.
Ratanakkiri provincial governor Pav Hamphan said yesterday that he was not aware of the sub-decree granting development of a portion of the national park, which consists of about 332,500 total hectares of forest land. [The Phnom Penh Post, march 2011]
Sources:
LICADHO (Cambodian League for the Promotion and Defense of Human Rights), 2013. Economic land concessions for agriculture and Industrialization granted in Cambodia between 1998-2012. Data obtained from LICADHO, March 2013.

primarynam: Río Rucio Forest Reserve Protectress National
allnames: Reserva Forestal Protectora Nacional Río Rucio, Río Rucio Forest Reserve Protectress National
Supporting: Law 685 of 2001, article 34 of the mining code whose validity lasts from 2001 to 2010, affected the category of the National System of Natural Parks and presents a systemic downgrading event. This was precluded by  Sentence C-649 of 1997 issued by the Constitutional Court.  This enabled portions of reserves to be downsized (substracted/\substraer\" for mining activities) and affected 102 protected areas.

GeoDataTyp: Artículo 34. Zonas excluibles de la minería. \"No podrán ejecutarse trabajos y obras de exploración y explotación mineras en zonas declaradas y delimitadas conforme a la normatividad vigente como de protección y desarrollo de los recursos naturales renovables o del ambiente y que
Region: de acuerdo con las disposiciones legales sobre la materia
Country: expresamente excluyan dichos trabajos y obras. Las zonas de exclusión mencionadas serán las que se constituyan conforme a las disposiciones vigentes
ISO3166: como áreas que integran el sistema de parques nacionales naturales
WDPAID: parques naturales de carácter regional y zonas de reserva forestales. Estas zonas para producir estos efectos
Location_K: deberán ser delimitadas geográficamente por la autoridad ambiental con base en estudios técnicos
PACODE: sociales y ambientales con la colaboración de la autoridad minera
primarynam: en aquellas áreas de interés minero. Para que puedan excluirse o restringirse trabajos y obras de exploración y explotación mineras en  las zonas de protección y desarrollo de los recursos naturales renovables o del ambiente
allnames: el acto que las declare deberá estar expresamente motivado en estudios que determinen la incompatibilidad o restricción en relación con las actividades mineras. No obstante
EventType: la autoridad minera previo acto administrativo fundamentado de la autoridad ambiental que decrete la sustracción del área requerida
EnactedPro: podrá autorizar que en las zonas mencionadas en el presente artículo
YearPADDD: puedan adelantarse actividades mineras en forma restringida o sólo por determinados métodos y sistemas de extracción que no afecten los objetivos de la zona de exclusión. Para tal efecto
Cause: el interesado en el Contrato de Concesión deberá presentar los estudios que demuestren la compatibilidad de las actividades mineras con tales objetivos./ Article 34. Excludable areas of mining. Works and works can not be executed exploration and exploitation in areas declared and delimited in accordance with the current regulations as protection and development of natural resources or environment
Size_Pre: in accordance with the legal provisions on material
Size_Post: expressly exclude such works and works. The exclusion zones mentioned will be those that are constituted according to the current provisions
IUCN_pre: as areas that make up the national parks system natural parks
IUCN_post: regional nature parks and forest reserve areas. These areas to produce these effects

primarynam: Sierra el Peligro Forest Reserve Protectress National
allnames: Reserva Forestal Protectora Nacional Sierra el Peligro, Sierra el Peligro Forest Reserve Protectress National
Supporting:
Law 99 of 1993, article 49 of 1974 (and related Decree 1220 of 2005) was issued by the Congress of Colombia. Its validity lasted from 1974 to 2010. It affected the category of National Protective Forest Reserves (Reservas Forestales Protectoras Nacionales) and constituted an enacted systemic downgrading event. It affected the 57 National Protective Forest Reserves that were established at the time. 

This law states that it is possible within Forest Reserves to carry out economic activities, such as the construction of infrastructure works, roads, reservoirs, dams or buildings, provided it is proven that they do not undermine the conservation of the renewable resources of the area. All economic activities that do not require an environmental license can be developed within the forest reserve areas, as long as no one of the causes that make the removal necessary, and implementing the necessary means to protect the reserve.

primarynam: Río Bobo y Buesaquillo Forest Reserve Protectress National
allnames: Reserva Forestal Protectora Nacional Río Bobo y Buesaquillo, Río Bobo y Buesaquillo Forest Reserve Protectress National
Supporting:
Decree 2372 of 2010 issued by the Ministry of Environment, Housing and Territorial Development whose validity lasts from 2010 to 2017, affected the categories of Protective Forest Reserves, integrated management districts, soil conservation districts and recreation protected areas, and constitutes a systemic downgrading event for national protective reserves and integrated management districts. This Decree regulates the substraction of protected areas (applies to 57 units). 

\Articulo 30. SUSTRACCiÓN DE ÁREAS PROTEGIDAS. La conservación y mejoramiento del ambiente es de utilidad pública e interés social. Cuando por otras razones de utilidad pública e interés social se proyecten desarrollar usos y actividades no permitidas al interior de un área protegida
Sources: atendiendo al régimen legal de la categoría de manejo
Map_Details: el interesado en el proyecto deberá solicitar previamente la sustracción del área de interés ante la autoridad que la declaró. En el evento que conforme a las normas que regulan cada área protegida
Map_Sources: no sea factible realizar la sustracción del área protegida
Notes: se procederá a manifestarlo mediante acto administrativo motivado rechazando la solicitud y procediendo a su archivo. La autoridad encargada de adelantar el trámite de sustracción
Date_Add: para resolver la solicitud deberá tener en cuenta al menos los siguientes criterios
Last_Update: los cuales deberán ser analizados de forma integral y complementaria: a) Representatividad ecológica: Que la zona a sustraer no incluya elementos de biodiversidad (paisajes
isLatestVe: no representados o insuficientemente representados en el sistema nacional de áreas protegidas
Data_Status: de acuerdo a las metas de conservación definidas. b) Integridad ecológica: Que la zona a sustraer no permita que se mantenga la integridad ecológica del área protegida o no garantice la dinámica natural de cambio de los atributos que caracterizan su biodiversidad. c) Irremplazabilidad: Que la zona a sustraer no considere muestras únicas o
Peer_Reviewed: ~ poco comunes y remanentes de tipos de ecosistemas. d) Representatividad de especies: Que la zona a sustraer no incluya el hábitat de especies consideradas en alguna categoría global
Study_Link: nacional o regional de amenaza
Off_Type: conforme el ámbito de gestión de la categoría. e) Significado cultural: Que la zona a sustraer no incluya espacios naturales que contribuyan al mantenimiento de zonas estratégicas de conservación cultural
Off_Area: como un proceso activo para la pervivencia de los grupos étnicos reconocidos como culturas diferenciadas en el país.

primarynam: Cuenca Alta del Río Mocoa Forest Reserve Protectress National
allnames: Reserva Forestal Protectora Nacional Cuenca Alta del Río Mocoa, Cuenca Alta del Río Mocoa Forest Reserve Protectress National
Supporting:
Law 99 of 1993, article 49 of 1974 (and related Decree 1220 of 2005) was issued by the Congress of Colombia. Its validity lasted from 1974 to 2010. It affected the category of National Protective Forest Reserves (Reservas Forestales Protectoras Nacionales) and constituted an enacted systemic downgrading event. It affected the 57 National Protective Forest Reserves that were established at the time. 

This law states that it is possible within Forest Reserves to carry out economic activities, such as the construction of infrastructure works, roads, reservoirs, dams or buildings, provided it is proven that they do not undermine the conservation of the renewable resources of the area. All economic activities that do not require an environmental license can be developed within the forest reserve areas, as long as no one of the causes that make the removal necessary, and implementing the necessary means to protect the reserve.
Sources: http://www.humboldt.org.co/images/documentos/pdf/Normativo/1993-12-22-ley-99-crea-el-sina-y-mma.pdf
Study_Link: R.E. Golden Kroner et al., The uncertain future of protected lands and waters. Science. 31, 364 (6443), 881-886 (2019). DOI: 10.1126/science.aau5525.
Rev_Details: The law was valid betwen 1993 and 2010
Rev_Source: Law 685 of 2001, article 34 of the mining code. Sentence C-649 of 1997 issued by the Constitutional Court whose validity lasts from 2001 to 2010, affecting the category of the National System of Natural Parks and presents a systemic downsizing event

This Decree regulates the substraction of protected areas (applies to 57 units). 

\Articulo 30. SUSTRACCiÓN DE ÁREAS PROTEGIDAS. La conservación y mejoramiento del ambiente es de utilidad pública e interés social. Cuando por otras razones de utilidad pública e interés social se proyecten desarrollar usos y actividades no permitidas al interior de un área protegida
Sources: atendiendo al régimen legal de la categoría de manejo

Date_Add: para resolver la solicitud deberá tener en cuenta al menos los siguientes criterios
Last_Update: los cuales deberán ser analizados de forma integral y complementaria: a) Representatividad ecológica: Que la zona a sustraer no incluya elementos de biodiversidad (paisajes
isLatestVe: no representados o insuficientemente representados en el sistema nacional de áreas protegidas
Data_Status: de acuerdo a las metas de conservación definidas. b) Integridad ecológica: Que la zona a sustraer no permita que se mantenga la integridad ecológica del área protegida o no garantice la dinámica natural de cambio de los atributos que caracterizan su biodiversidad. c) Irremplazabilidad: Que la zona a sustraer no considere muestras únicas o
Peer_Reviewed: ~ poco comunes y remanentes de tipos de ecosistemas. d) Representatividad de especies: Que la zona a sustraer no incluya el hábitat de especies consideradas en alguna categoría global
Study_Link: nacional o regional de amenaza
Off_Type: conforme el ámbito de gestión de la categoría. e) Significado cultural: Que la zona a sustraer no incluya espacios naturales que contribuyan al mantenimiento de zonas estratégicas de conservación cultural
Off_Area: como un proceso activo para la pervivencia de los grupos étnicos reconocidos como culturas diferenciadas en el país.

primarynam: Ríos Chorrera y Concepción Forest Reserve Protectress National
allnames: Reserva Forestal Protectora Nacional Ríos Chorrera y Concepción, Ríos Chorrera y Concepción Forest Reserve Protectress National
Supporting:
Law 99 of 1993, article 49 of 1974 (and related Decree 1220 of 2005) was issued by the Congress of Colombia. Its validity lasted from 1974 to 2010. It affected the category of National Protective Forest Reserves (Reservas Forestales Protectoras Nacionales) and constituted an enacted systemic downgrading event. It affected the 57 National Protective Forest Reserves that were established at the time. 

This law states that it is possible within Forest Reserves to carry out economic activities, such as the construction of infrastructure works, roads, reservoirs, dams or buildings, provided it is proven that they do not undermine the conservation of the renewable resources of the area. All economic activities that do not require an environmental license can be developed within the forest reserve areas, as long as no one of the causes that make the removal necessary, and implementing the necessary means to protect the reserve.
Sources: http://www.humboldt.org.co/images/documentos/pdf/Normativo/1993-12-22-ley-99-crea-el-sina-y-mma.pdf
Study_Link: R.E. Golden Kroner et al., The uncertain future of protected lands and waters. Science. 31, 364 (6443), 881-886 (2019). DOI: 10.1126/science.aau5525.

primarynam: Bosque Oriental de Bogotá Forest Reserve Protectress National
allnames: Reserva Forestal Protectora Nacional Bosque Oriental de Bogotá, Bosque Oriental de Bogotá Forest Reserve Protectress National
Supporting:
Resolución 463 de 2005 by the Ministry of Environment, Housing and Territorial Development. Excludes a portion of the reserve, as it was experiencing land use change, urban encroachment, illegal mining, and other pressures. Redrawing boundary was an effort to consolidate the reserve and rezone the area with the objectives of promoting conservation, restoration, and rehabilitation. A court decision later in 2005 suspended the decision to downsize the reserve. Text from the legal document: 

\RESOLUCION 0463 DE 2005

PADDD_ID: NOTA: El Tribunal Administrativo de C/marca. suspendió provisionalmente los efectos de la Resolución 0463 de 2005
Region: solamente en cuanto excluye una parte del Área de Reserva Protectora del Bosque Oriental de Bogotá
Country: comprendida en el artículo 2 de la Resolución No. 076 de 1977. Ver Fallo 662 de 2006 del Tribunal Administrativo de Cundinamarca

PADDD_ID: por medio de la cual se redelimita la Reserva Forestal Protectora Bosque Oriental de Bogotá
GeoDataTyp: se adopta su zonificación y reglamentación de usos y se establecen las determinantes para el ordenamiento y manejo de los Cerros Orientales de Bogotá.

PADDD_ID: en uso de sus facultades legales y en especial
Region: numerales 18 y 19 y 6º de la Ley 99 de 1993 y en el artículo 2º del Decreto-ley 216 de 2003

GeoDataTyp: los Cerros Orientales han sufrido en algunos sectores procesos de cambio de los usos del suelo
Region: que no son compatibles con los permitidos en el artículo 206 del Código de los Recursos Naturales Renovables y del Medio Ambiente
Country: para las zonas de reserva forestal protectora
ISO3166: ya que en la actualidad coexisten diferentes usos
WDPAID: de tipo urbanístico en su zona de borde
PACODE: con relevantes impactos y efectos ambientales sobre los ecosistemas y sobre los servicios ambientales que prestan a comunidades locales que se benefician de ella
primarynam: por lo que se requiere contar con un instrumento de planificación
allnames: ordenamiento y manejo para restaurar
EventType: recuperar y armonizar las condiciones sociales

PADDD_ID: Que dichos efectos se ven representados sobre la transformación de ecosistemas en alrededor de 519 hectáreas (3.7% de la Reserva) por el desarrollo de asentamientos humanos de manera concentrada de todos los estratos
GeoDataTyp: muchos de ellos en zonas de alto riesgo y sobre zonas de preservación ambiental. Igualmente se han generado efectos de degradación de ecosistemas por el desarrollo de minería de origen ilegal de manera dispersa (62 canteras al interior y 43 más cerca del borde urbano) con impactos en el paisaje y en la regulación hídrica
Region: en alrededor de 120 hectáreas (0.85% de la Reserva)
Country: así como otras áreas más extensas afectadas por el desarrollo de ganadería y agricultura asociada a viviendas campesinas

GeoDataTyp: determinó que al interior de la Reserva Forestal Protectora Bosque Oriental de Bogotá
Region: existen usos que no son compatibles con la conservación de los bosques allí existentes
Country: lo que obliga a las autoridades ambientales a analizar diferentes alternativas de ordenamiento con miras a realizar un manejo coherente con la situación real del territorio

PADDD_ID: Que teniendo en cuenta lo anterior
GeoDataTyp: es necesario combinar y complementar diferentes estrategias que involucren: el dominio del Estado sobre las áreas de mayor valor ecológico
Region: la apropiación y el control social mediante el adecuado uso público en las áreas aptas para tal función
Country: la concertación del uso sostenible y el aporte de los particulares a la conservación de acuerdo con la capacidad de carga de cada espacio
ISO3166: la apropiada reglamentación y el control por parte de las autoridades ambientales competentes y el aprovechamiento y refuerzo de las limitaciones físicas para la restricción de las formas de uso y ocupación incompatibles;…

PADDD_ID: Que como resultado de lo anterior
Country: teniendo como sustento las discusiones sostenidas al interior de la Comisión Conjunta
Location_K: normativo y fáctico de los asentamientos dispuestos a lo largo del costado occidental de la reserva
PACODE: entrará a revisar en la presente Resolución las siguientes alternativas desde el punto de vista técnico y jurídico:

PADDD_ID: a) Redelimitar la Reserva Forestal Protectora Bosque Oriental de Bogotá
GeoDataTyp: adoptando la zonificación y reglamentación de usos correspondiente;

PADDD_ID: b) Establecer para las áreas excluidas de la Reserva
GeoDataTyp: medidas generales de ordenamiento y manejo que sean compatibles con los objetivos del Area de Reserva Forestal Protectora y cuya competencia según la Ley 388 de 1997 corresponde al Distrito Capital;

PADDD_ID: c) E stablecer las determinantes de ordenamiento y manejo para la consolidación del límite urbano en el costado occidental de la Reserva Forestal Protectora Bosque Oriental de Bogotá
GeoDataTyp: de tal manera que se mitigue la presión de intervenciones en el área
Region: las cuales deberán ser incorporadas por el Distrito Capital en el Plan de Ordenamiento Territorial y en su reglamentación de usos del suelo.…

PADDD_ID: Las estrategias mencionadas se desarrollarán mediante las siguientes acciones puntuales:
1. Redelimitación del área protegida Bosque Oriental de Bogotá
a) Mantener una estructura ecológica funcional que reconozca y potencie la integralidad y conectividad de los ecosistemas que hacen parte de la reserva forestal
GeoDataTyp: y al mismo tiempo configure un ordenamiento armónico y normalizado de los bordes urbanos de la ciudad de Bogotá que limitan con el área protegida;

PADDD_ID: b) Consolidar el área protegida como elemento fundamental de la estructura ecológica
Region: funcional y espacial de la ciudad de Bogotá y su relación con los municipios aledaños
Country: fijando determinantes ambientales y de ordenamiento;

PADDD_ID: c) Establecer una franja de adecuación entre la reserva forestal protectora y el perímetro urbano de la ciudad de Bogotá
GeoDataTyp: que actúe como espacio de consolidación de la estructura urbana y como zona de amortiguación y de contención definitiva de los procesos de urbanización de los Cerros Orientales;

PADDD_ID: d) Evitar nuevos procesos de urbanización ilegal en áreas libres que son objeto de fuerte presión urbanística
GeoDataTyp: mediante la promoción de un desarrollo legal bajo los diferentes instrumentos de planeamiento que favorezcan y garanticen la armonía de los usos del suelo con la reserva forestal;

PADDD_ID: e) Es tablecer un realinderamiento geográfico de la reserva forestal siguiendo en lo posible límites arcifinios a través de vías
ISO3166: de tal manera que facilite a las autoridades ambientales y distritales la adecuada gestión administrativa
WDPAID: de acuerdo con el ámbito de sus competencias
Location_K: tanto en el área protegida como en los bordes urbanos que colindan con ella.

PADDD_ID: Dicho alinderamiento se establece sobre cartografía oficial del IGAC a escala 1:10.000 producida en el año 2003. De manera particular
GeoDataTyp: el límite occidental de la reserva se describe utilizando en lo posible corredores viales y curvas de nivel
Region: acompañados con algunos referentes sobre ejes de ríos
WDPAID: buscando la aplicación de los criterios anteriormente mencionados;

PADDD_ID: f) Armonizar el límite occidental de la reserva forestal con el perímetro urbano en este sector de manera consecuente con lo establecido en el artículo 117 del Decreto 469 de 2003 (Revisión POT de Bogotá);
g) Sobre los espacios urbanos que resulten de la armonización de los bordes urbanos con la Reserva Forestal
GeoDataTyp: establecer determinantes que orienten y garanticen el equilibrio entre la estructura y dinámica urbana y los propósitos y objetivos del ordenamiento y manejo de la Reserva Forestal;

PADDD_ID: h) Armonizar sus límites con las condiciones reales de los asentamientos urbanos dispuestos en su borde y que están funcionalmente articulados con la ciudad y con aquellos localizados a lo largo del corredor de La Calera.
2. Zonificación interna de la Reserva Forestal Protectora Bosque Oriental de Bogotá
GeoDataTyp: mediante el desarrollo de las siguientes acciones generales:

PADDD_ID: a) Estabilizar y en muchos casos reversar los procesos de deterioro que han dado lugar al desmejoramiento ambiental de la reserva

primarynam: Río Blanco y Quebrada Olivares Forest Reserve Protectress National
allnames: Reserva Forestal Protectora Nacional Río Blanco y Quebrada Olivares, Río Blanco y Quebrada Olivares Forest Reserve Protectress National
Supporting:
Law 99 of 1993, article 49 of 1974 (and related Decree 1220 of 2005) was issued by the Congress of Colombia. Its validity lasted from 1974 to 2010. It affected the category of National Protective Forest Reserves (Reservas Forestales Protectoras Nacionales) and constituted an enacted systemic downgrading event. It affected the 57 National Protective Forest Reserves that were established at the time. 

This law states that it is possible within Forest Reserves to carry out economic activities, such as the construction of infrastructure works, roads, reservoirs, dams or buildings, provided it is proven that they do not undermine the conservation of the renewable resources of the area. All economic activities that do not require an environmental license can be developed within the forest reserve areas, as long as no one of the causes that make the removal necessary, and implementing the necessary means to protect the reserve.
Sources: http://www.humboldt.org.co/images/documentos/pdf/Normativo/1993-12-22-ley-99-crea-el-sina-y-mma.pdf
Study_Link: R.E. Golden Kroner et al., The uncertain future of protected lands and waters. Science. 31, 364 (6443), 881-886 (2019). DOI: 10.1126/science.aau5525.

primarynam: Río Anchicaya Forest Reserve Protectress National
allnames: Reserva Forestal Protectora Nacional Río Anchicaya, Río Anchicaya Forest Reserve Protectress National
Supporting:
Law 99 of 1993, article 49 of 1974 (and related Decree 1220 of 2005) was issued by the Congress of Colombia. Its validity lasted from 1974 to 2010. It affected the category of National Protective Forest Reserves (Reservas Forestales Protectoras Nacionales) and constituted an enacted systemic downgrading event. It affected the 57 National Protective Forest Reserves that were established at the time. 

This law states that it is possible within Forest Reserves to carry out economic activities, such as the construction of infrastructure works, roads, reservoirs, dams or buildings, provided it is proven that they do not undermine the conservation of the renewable resources of the area. All economic activities that do not require an environmental license can be developed within the forest reserve areas, as long as no one of the causes that make the removal necessary, and implementing the necessary means to protect the reserve.
Sources: http://www.humboldt.org.co/images/documentos/pdf/Normativo/1993-12-22-ley-99-crea-el-sina-y-mma.pdf
Study_Link: R.E. Golden Kroner et al., The uncertain future of protected lands and waters. Science. 31, 364 (6443), 881-886 (2019). DOI: 10.1126/science.aau5525.
Rev_Details: The law was valid betwen 1993 and 2010
Rev_Source: Law 685 of 2001, article 34 of the mining code. Sentence C-649 of 1997 issued by the Constitutional Court whose validity lasts from 2001 to 2010, affecting the category of the National System of Natural Parks and presents a systemic downsizing event

allnames: Reserva Forestal Protectora Nacional Quebrada La Nona, Quebrada La Nona Forest Reserve Protectress National
Supporting:
Decree 2372 of 2010 issued by the Ministry of Environment, Housing and Territorial Development whose validity lasts from 2010 to 2017, affected the categories of Protective Forest Reserves, integrated management districts, soil conservation districts and recreation protected areas, and constitutes a systemic downgrading event for national protective reserves and integrated management districts. This Decree regulates the substraction of protected areas (applies to 57 units).

primarynam: Cuenca Alta del Río Jirocasaca Forest Reserve Protectress National
allnames: Reserva Forestal Protectora Nacional Cuenca Alta del Río Jirocasaca, Cuenca Alta del Río Jirocasaca Forest Reserve Protectress National
Supporting:
Law 99 of 1993, article 49 of 1974 (and related Decree 1220 of 2005) was issued by the Congress of Colombia. Its validity lasted from 1974 to 2010. It affected the category of National Protective Forest Reserves (Reservas Forestales Protectoras Nacionales) and constituted an enacted systemic downgrading event. It affected the 57 National Protective Forest Reserves that were established at the time. 

This law states that it is possible within Forest Reserves to carry out economic activities, such as the construction of infrastructure works, roads, reservoirs, dams or buildings, provided it is proven that they do not undermine the conservation of the renewable resources of the area. All economic activities that do not require an environmental license can be developed within the forest reserve areas, as long as no one of the causes that make the removal necessary, and implementing the necessary means to protect the reserve.
Sources: http://www.humboldt.org.co/images/documentos/pdf/Normativo/1993-12-22-ley-99-crea-el-sina-y-mma.pdf
Study_Link: R.E. Golden Kroner et al., The uncertain future of protected lands and waters. Science. 31, 364 (6443), 881-886 (2019). DOI: 10.1126/science.aau5525.
Rev_Details: The law was valid betwen 1993 and 2010
Rev_Source: Law 685 of 2001, article 34 of the mining code. Sentence C-649 of 1997 issued by the Constitutional Court whose validity lasts from 2001 to 2010, affecting the category of the National System of Natural Parks and presents a systemic downsizing event

primarynam: Cuchilla Peñas Blancas Forest Reserve Protectress National
allnames: Reserva Forestal Protectora Nacional Cuchilla Peñas Blancas, Cuchilla Peñas Blancas Forest Reserve Protectress National
Supporting:
Law 99 of 1993, article 49 of 1974 (and related Decree 1220 of 2005) was issued by the Congress of Colombia. Its validity lasted from 1974 to 2010. It affected the category of National Protective Forest Reserves (Reservas Forestales Protectoras Nacionales) and constituted an enacted systemic downgrading event. It affected the 57 National Protective Forest Reserves that were established at the time. 

This law states that it is possible within Forest Reserves to carry out economic activities, such as the construction of infrastructure works, roads, reservoirs, dams or buildings, provided it is proven that they do not undermine the conservation of the renewable resources of the area. All economic activities that do not require an environmental license can be developed within the forest reserve areas, as long as no one of the causes that make the removal necessary, and implementing the necessary means to protect the reserve.
Sources: http://www.humboldt.org.co/images/documentos/pdf/Normativo/1993-12-22-ley-99-crea-el-sina-y-mma.pdf
Study_Link: R.E. Golden Kroner et al., The uncertain future of protected lands and waters. Science. 31, 364 (6443), 881-886 (2019). DOI: 10.1126/science.aau5525.
Rev_Details: The law was valid betwen 1993 and 2010
Rev_Source: Law 685 of 2001, article 34 of the mining code. Sentence C-649 of 1997 issued by the Constitutional Court whose validity lasts from 2001 to 2010, affecting the category of the National System of Natural Parks and presents a systemic downsizing event

Supporting:
Resolución 1914 de 2015 by the Ministry of Environment, Housing and Territorial Development. Reduces the Reserva Forestal Protectora Nacional Cuenca Alta del Río Cali by 2.15 hectares to enable the building of a road. Legal document (in Sources) describes the plan for the road including figures, tables, and coordinates of the substracted area. Study_Link: R.E. Golden Kroner et al., The uncertain future of protected lands and waters. Science. 31, 364 (6443), 881-886 (2019). DOI: 10.1126/science.aau5525.

primarynam: Cuenca Alta del Río Nembí Forest Reserve Protectress National
allnames: Reserva Forestal Protectora Nacional Cuenca Alta del Río Nembí, Cuenca Alta del Río Nembí Forest Reserve Protectress National
Supporting:
Law 99 of 1993, article 49 of 1974 (and related Decree 1220 of 2005) was issued by the Congress of Colombia. Its validity lasted from 1974 to 2010. It affected the category of National Protective Forest Reserves (Reservas Forestales Protectoras Nacionales) and constituted an enacted systemic downgrading event. It affected the 57 National Protective Forest Reserves that were established at the time. 

This law states that it is possible within Forest Reserves to carry out economic activities, such as the construction of infrastructure works, roads, reservoirs, dams or buildings, provided it is proven that they do not undermine the conservation of the renewable resources of the area. All economic activities that do not require an environmental license can be developed within the forest reserve areas, as long as no one of the causes that make the removal necessary, and implementing the necessary means to protect the reserve.
Sources: http://www.humboldt.org.co/images/documentos/pdf/Normativo/1993-12-22-ley-99-crea-el-sina-y-mma.pdf
Study_Link: R.E. Golden Kroner et al., The uncertain future of protected lands and waters. Science. 31, 364 (6443), 881-886 (2019). DOI: 10.1126/science.aau5525.

primarynam: Quebrada Honda y Caños Parrado y Buque Forest Reserve Protectress National
allnames: Reserva Forestal Protectora Nacional Quebrada Honda y Caños Parrado y Buque, Quebrada Honda y Caños Parrado y Buque Forest Reserve Protectress National
Supporting:
Resolución 2350 de 2009. Reduces the area of the Quebrada Honda y Caños Parrado y Buque Protected Forest Reserve by 0.468 hectares to enable the building of a bridge. 

Por la cual se sustrae parcialmente la Reserva Forestal Protectora Quebrada Honda y Caños Parrado y Buque constituida mediante la resolución No 59 de Abril 4 de 1945 y se toman otras determinaciones. / By which the Protected Forest Reserve Quebrada Honda and Caños Parrado and Buque constituted by Resolution No. 59 of April 4, 1945 are partially subtracted and other determinations are made.

“RESUELVE:

Artículo 1°. Sustraer parcialmente de la Reserva Forestal Protectora Quebrada Honda y Caños Parrado y Buque constituida mediante la Resolución número 59 de abril 4 de 1945 del Ministerio de la Economía Nacional, un área de 0.468 hectáreas para la construcción de un puente sobre el caño Parrado, sector Galán-Mesetas del municipio de Villavicencio en el departamento del Meta. 

Parágrafo 1°. El área a sustraer con el objeto anteriormente citado se encuentra dentro del polígono delimitado por las siguientes coordenadas planas (Nortes, Estes):

Punto 1 951260.060 N – 1046748.814 E
Punto 2 951257.272 N – 1046759.971 E
Punto 3 951057.113 N – 1046709.959 E
Punto 4 951059.901 N – 1046698.802 E
Punto 5 951028.453 N – 1046688.565 E
Punto 6 951023.736 N – 1046700.894 E
Punto 7 950996.161 N – 1046685.627 E
Punto 8 951003.700 N – 1046674.792 E
Punto 9 950941.222 N – 1046625.526 E
Punto 10 950932.995 N – 1046635.849 E
Punto 11 950918.447 N – 1046623.601 E
Punto 12 950922.862 N – 1046615.188 E
Punto 13 950905.459 N – 1046606.348 E
Punto 14 950898.022 N – 1046616.218 E

Parágrafo 2°. Para el diseño y construcción del puente se deberán implementar medidas de manejo a fin de evitar la desestabilización de taludes y la alteración de la dinámica hídrica del caño Parrado, dada la ubicación del proyecto en un área de reserva forestal protectora.

Parágrafo 3°. La condición de zona de reserva forestal protectora del área aledaña del proyecto permanece, por tal motivo, de requerirse modificar el área sustraída y/o ampliar los corredores de acceso al puente, se deberá solicitar la respectiva sustracción del área, para lo cual deberán anexarse los estudios técnicos respectivos.
/ 
RESOLVES:
Article 1. Partially subtract from the Protected Forest Reserve Quebrada Honda and Caños Parrado and Buque constituted by Resolution number 59 of April 4, 1945 of the Ministry of the National Economy, an area of 0.468 hectares for the construction of a bridge over the Parrado canal, sector Galán -Metatas of the municipality of Villavicencio in the department of Meta.
Paragraph 1 °. The area to be subtracted with the aforementioned object is inside the polygon delimited by the following plane coordinates (Nortes, Estes):
Item 1 951260.060 N - 1046748.814 E
Item 2 951257.272 N - 1046759.971 E
Item 3 951057.113 N - 1046709.959 E
Item 4 951059.901 N - 1046698.802 E
Item 5 951028.453 N - 1046688.565 E
Item 6 951023.736 N - 1046700.894 E
Item 7 950996.161 N - 1046685627 E
Item 8 951003.700 N - 1046674.792 E
Item 9 950941.222 N - 1046625.526 E
Item 10 950932.995 N - 1046635.849 E
Item 11 950918.447 N - 1046623.601 E
Item 12 950922.862 N - 1046615.188 E
Item 13 950905.459 N - 1046606.348 E
Item 14 950898.022 N - 1046616.218 E
Paragraph 2 °. For the design and construction of the bridge, management measures should be implemented in order to avoid the destabilization of slopes and the alteration of the water dynamics of the Parrado canal, given the location of the project in a protected forest reserve area. Paragraph 3 °. The condition of protective forest reserve area of the project area remains, for this reason, it is necessary to modify the subtracted area and / or broaden the access corridors to the bridge, the respective subtraction of the area must be requested, for which they must be annexed the respective technical studies.”

http://www.notinet.com.co/pedidos/res2350.doc

primarynam: Cerro Quinini Forest Reserve Protectress National
allnames: Reserva Forestal Protectora Nacional Cerro Quinini, Cerro Quinini Forest Reserve Protectress National
Supporting:
Law 99 of 1993, article 49 of 1974 (and related Decree 1220 of 2005) was issued by the Congress of Colombia. Its validity lasted from 1974 to 2010. It affected the category of National Protective Forest Reserves (Reservas Forestales Protectoras Nacionales) and constituted an enacted systemic downgrading event. It affected the 57 National Protective Forest Reserves that were established at the time. 

This law states that it is possible within Forest Reserves to carry out economic activities, such as the construction of infrastructure works, roads, reservoirs, dams or buildings, provided it is proven that they do not undermine the conservation of the renewable resources of the area. All economic activities that do not require an environmental license can be developed within the forest reserve areas, as long as no one of the causes that make the removal necessary, and implementing the necessary means to protect the reserve.
Sources: http://www.humboldt.org.co/images/documentos/pdf/Normativo/1993-12-22-ley-99-crea-el-sina-y-mma.pdf
Study_Link: R.E. Golden Kroner et al., The uncertain future of protected lands and waters. Science. 31, 364 (6443), 881-886 (2019). DOI: 10.1126/science.aau5525.

primarynam: Cuenca Alta del Río Cali Forest Reserve Protectress National
allnames: Reserva Forestal Protectora Nacional Cuenca Alta del Río Cali, Cuenca Alta del Río Cali Forest Reserve Protectress National
Supporting:
Law 99 of 1993, article 49 of 1974 (and related Decree 1220 of 2005) was issued by the Congress of Colombia. Its validity lasted from 1974 to 2010. It affected the category of National Protective Forest Reserves (Reservas Forestales Protectoras Nacionales) and constituted an enacted systemic downgrading event. It affected the 57 National Protective Forest Reserves that were established at the time. 

This law states that it is possible within Forest Reserves to carry out economic activities, such as the construction of infrastructure works, roads, reservoirs, dams or buildings, provided it is proven that they do not undermine the conservation of the renewable resources of the area. All economic activities that do not require an environmental license can be developed within the forest reserve areas, as long as no one of the causes that make the removal necessary, and implementing the necessary means to protect the reserve.
Sources: http://www.humboldt.org.co/images/documentos/pdf/Normativo/1993-12-22-ley-99-crea-el-sina-y-mma.pdf
Study_Link: R.E. Golden Kroner et al., The uncertain future of protected lands and waters. Science. 31, 364 (6443), 881-886 (2019). DOI: 10.1126/science.aau5525.
Rev_Details: The law was valid betwen 1993 and 2010
Rev_Source: Law 685 of 2001, article 34 of the mining code. Sentence C-649 of 1997 issued by the Constitutional Court whose validity lasts from 2001 to 2010, affecting the category of the National System of Natural Parks and presents a systemic downsizing event

primarynam: Río Nare Forest Reserve Protectress National

Supporting:
Resolución 1510 de 2010 by the Ministry of Environment, Housing and Territorial Development. Excludes 80.73 hectares from the Río Nare Forest Reserve Protectress National to consolidate its management activities. 

“Resuelve:
Articulo 1: Redelimitacion:
Redelimitar el Area de Reserva Forestal Protectora del Rio Nare declarada a traves del Acuerdo 31 de 1970 de la Junto Directiva del Inderena, aprobado mediante la Resolucion Ejecutiva 24 de 1971 del Minsiterio de Agricultura, con el fin de armonizar los elementos de orden ambiental y territorial para su adecuado manejo y administracion, la cual qudara comprendida dentro de los limites que se señalan a continuacion referenciado sen Sistema MAGNA SIRGAS origen Bogota:…
Paragrafo 1: Los poligonos que se presentan a continuacion, cuya superficie es de 80.73 hectareas, no hacen parte del area redlimintada y se consideran excluidas…/
\Resolved:

PADDD_ID: Redefine the Protected Forest Reserve Area of the Nare River declared through Agreement 31 of 1970 of the Together Board of Inderena

Region: in order to harmonize the elements of environmental and territorial order for its proper management and administration
Country: which will be included within the limits indicated below. System MAGNA SIRGAS origin Bogota: ...

primarynam: Río Tejo Forest Reserve Protectress National
allnames: Reserva Forestal Protectora Nacional Río Tejo, Río Tejo Forest Reserve Protectress National
Supporting:
Law 99 of 1993, article 49 of 1974 (and related Decree 1220 of 2005) was issued by the Congress of Colombia. Its validity lasted from 1974 to 2010. It affected the category of National Protective Forest Reserves (Reservas Forestales Protectoras Nacionales) and constituted an enacted systemic downgrading event. It affected the 57 National Protective Forest Reserves that were established at the time. 

This law states that it is possible within Forest Reserves to carry out economic activities, such as the construction of infrastructure works, roads, reservoirs, dams or buildings, provided it is proven that they do not undermine the conservation of the renewable resources of the area. All economic activities that do not require an environmental license can be developed within the forest reserve areas, as long as no one of the causes that make the removal necessary, and implementing the necessary means to protect the reserve.
Sources: http://www.humboldt.org.co/images/documentos/pdf/Normativo/1993-12-22-ley-99-crea-el-sina-y-mma.pdf
Study_Link: R.E. Golden Kroner et al., The uncertain future of protected lands and waters. Science. 31, 364 (6443), 881-886 (2019). DOI: 10.1126/science.aau5525.

Rev_Source: Law 685 of 2001, article 34 of the mining code. Sentence C-649 of 1997 issued by the Constitutional Court whose validity lasts from 2001 to 2010, affecting the category of the National System of Natural Parks and presents a systemic downsizing event

primarynam: Río Rucio Forest Reserve Protectress National

Supporting:
Decree 2372 of 2010 issued by the Ministry of Environment, Housing and Territorial Development whose validity lasts from 2010 to 2017, affected the categories of Protective Forest Reserves, integrated management districts, soil conservation districts and recreation protected areas, and constitutes a systemic downgrading event for national protective reserves and integrated management districts. This Decree regulates the substraction of protected areas (applies to 57 units). 

\Articulo 30. SUSTRACCiÓN DE ÁREAS PROTEGIDAS. La conservación y mejoramiento del ambiente es de utilidad pública e interés social. Cuando por otras razones de utilidad pública e interés social se proyecten desarrollar usos y actividades no permitidas al interior de un área protegida
Sources: atendiendo al régimen legal de la categoría de manejo
